titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John P. Hall, Indictment
CWG7533

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Union Equity & Criminal Court
The commonwealth of Kentucky
against
John P. Hall

The grand jury of Union County in the name and by the authority of the Commowealth of Kentucky, accuse John P Hall of the crime of murder Committed as follows (viz) The said John P Hall on the 1st day of May 1858 in the County aforesaid did feloniously and with malaice aforethought Kill and murder R W N Taylor by stabbing him with a knife so that he died thereby, against the peace and dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky

A. P. Thompson
Comth Atty 1st J. D.

A Copy,
Attest.
John S Geiger clk

At the October term 1860 of the Union Circuit Court. The defendant John P Hall was recognised in open court in the sum of Five thousand Dollars. with George Payne M M Berry. W H Wheeler. S D Payne. James Ross, E A Clark, H Minnehoff S R Springer Leroy Thomas, J W Berry. Samuel Cooper and W G Hughes as his sureties.

Attest,
John S Geiger clk U. C. C

Commth of Ky
vs } Indt for Murder
John P Hall
(A copy)

B
Call Catrance
Ballance Due
C California
